pros: You are helping people live better lives!
cons: Stressful due to demands on staff, hours.

pros: They offered Free meals for all staff, management was okay, there was team environment and almost everyone was willing to help
cons: They don’t care adding more roles to the kitchen aides if the nurses say so. Poor kitchen people have no voice. It’s a lot of work depending on which shift you are working and who you are working with. Limited room for progress.

review_title: Cares about staff, cares about residents
pros: Marbridge takes care of it's residents AND it's staff. Best possible place I could think of to work during this pandemic. Marbridge has gone above and beyond in keeping everyone safe. Co-workers and management at the Village are wonderful, we work together as a team and get along well.
cons: There are always cons, but they are not enough to dissuade from working here, so I will stick with the positives, as during these trying times they far out-way any cons.

pros: Fun job, pretty location, nice residents, independent
cons: Lower pay, meals do not taste good

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Manchaca, TX
pros: Good nurses and other aides. The people that work on the floor with you are extremely supportive.
cons: Management can be incredibly unprofessional and they are far from supportive.

The directors are extremely cheap. They charge 5k a month for each resident to live there and pocket the money so they can show up to work in brand new heavy duty trucks. Marbridge is not a "non-profit"

review_title: Great peers and residents but management is horrible
pros: Fulfilling work with disabled and passionate peers
cons: Management pushes work on lesser paid employees. Favoritism is huge.
I have no cons for this position.

pros: I liked working there when i did

I worked at Marbridge as a resident trainer for over a year, and I must say I absolutely love the residents that I had the pleasure of serving. Working at the independent living facility on weekends allowed for alot of 1 on 1 time with residents. They also have outings on weekends which usually consist of movies or various other outdoor activities. Miss this place often!
cons: Pay wasn't superb, but it I understand it takes alot to run a facility like theirs.

pros: Residents are a joy to be around and to care for. Pay scale is above average. A lot of overtime shifts available
cons: Constant bickering among shifts and staff. Orientation has much to be desired.

review_title: It's great working here. My coworkers are nice. The residents are nice
pros: Free breakfast, free lunch, keeps you busy.
cons: No busses go out this way. Theres no cons for the job

pros: Working with amazing residents every day
cons: Often working short and asked to pick up shifts
